member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.AddressId
member.summary: The ID of the IP address in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.CustomFields
member.summary:
A key/value map of custom fields for this address.
⚠️ **NOTE on custom fields:** PHPIPAM installations with custom fields must have all fields set to optional when using this plugin. For more info see [here](https://github.com/phpipam/phpipam/issues/1073). Further to this, either ensure that your fields also do not have default values, or ensure the default is set in your TF configuration. Diff loops may happen otherwise! Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.

member.summary: The description provided to this IP address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.DeviceId
member.summary: The ID of the associated device in the PHPIPAM database.

member.summary: The last time this resource was modified.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.ExcludePing
member.summary: `true` if this address is excluded from ping probes.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.Hostname
member.summary: The hostname supplied to this IP address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.IpAddress
member.summary: The IP address to reserve.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.IsGateway
member.summary: `true` if this IP address has been designated as a gateway.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.LastSeen

member.summary: The note supplied to this IP address.

member.summary: The owner name provided to this IP address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.PtrRecordId
member.summary: The ID of the associated PTR record in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.SkipPtrRecord
member.summary: `true` if PTR records are not being created for this IP address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Address.StateTagId
member.summary: The tag ID in the database for the IP address' specific state. **NOTE:** This is currently represented as an integer but may change to the specific string representation at a later time.

member.summary: The database ID of the subnet this IP address belongs to.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddress.InvokeAsync(Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressArgs,Pulumi.InvokeOptions)
M:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddress.Invoke(Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressInvokeArgs,Pulumi.InvokeOptions)
P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressArgs.CustomFieldFilter
member.summary:
A map of custom fields to search for. The filter values are regular expressions that follow the RE2 syntax for which you can find documentation [here](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax). All fields need to match for the match to succeed.
⚠️ **NOTE:** `description`, `hostname`, and `custom_field_filter` fields return the first match found without any warnings. If you are looking to return multiple addresses, combine this data source with the `phpipam.getAddresses` data source.
⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return the first address it sees in the subnet. Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.
Arguments are processed in the following order of precedence:

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressArgs.Description
member.summary: The description of the IP address. `subnet_id` is required when using this field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressArgs.Hostname
member.summary: The host name of the IP address. `subnet_id` is required when using this field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressArgs.SubnetId
member.summary: , and either one of `description`, `hostname`, or `custom_field_filter`

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressInvokeArgs.CustomFieldFilter
member.summary:
A map of custom fields to search for. The filter values are regular expressions that follow the RE2 syntax for which you can find documentation [here](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax). All fields need to match for the match to succeed.
⚠️ **NOTE:** `description`, `hostname`, and `custom_field_filter` fields return the first match found without any warnings. If you are looking to return multiple addresses, combine this data source with the `phpipam.getAddresses` data source.
⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return the first address it sees in the subnet. Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.
Arguments are processed in the following order of precedence:

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressInvokeArgs.Description
member.summary: The description of the IP address. `subnet_id` is required when using this field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressInvokeArgs.Hostname
member.summary: The host name of the IP address. `subnet_id` is required when using this field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressInvokeArgs.SubnetId
member.summary: , and either one of `description`, `hostname`, or `custom_field_filter`

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressesArgs.CustomFieldFilter
member.summary:
A map of custom fields to search for. The filter values are regular expressions that follow the RE2 syntax for which you can find documentation [here](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax). All fields need to match for the match to succeed.
⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return **all** addresses that contain the referenced custom field key! Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressesArgs.Description
member.summary: The description of the IP address. `subnet_id` is required when using this field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressesArgs.Hostname
member.summary: The host name of the IP address. `subnet_id` is required when using this field.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetAddressesArgs.SubnetId
member.summary:
The ID of the subnet that the address resides in. This is required to search on the `description` or `hostname` fields.
One of the following fields is required alongside `subnet_id`:

⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return **all** addresses that contain the referenced custom field key! Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnet.InvokeAsync(Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetArgs,Pulumi.InvokeOptions)
M:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnet.Invoke(Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetInvokeArgs,Pulumi.InvokeOptions)
P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetArgs.CustomFieldFilter
member.summary:
A map of custom fields to search for. The filter values are regular expressions that follow the RE2 syntax for which you can find documentation [here](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax). All fields need to match for the match to succeed.
⚠️ **NOTE:** Searches with the `description`, `description_match` and `custom_field_filter` fields return the first match found without any warnings. Conversely, the resource fails if it somehow finds multiple results on a CIDR (subnet and mask) search - this is to assert that you are getting the subnet you requested. If you want to return multiple results, combine this data source with the `phpipam.getSubnets` data source. Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.
⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return the first subnetit sees in the section.
Arguments are processed in the following order of precedence:

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetArgs.Description
member.summary: The subnet's description. `section_id` is required if you want to use this option.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetArgs.DescriptionMatch
member.summary: A regular expression to match against when searching for a subnet. `section_id` is required if you want to use this option.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetArgs.SectionId
member.summary: , and either one of `description`, `description_match`, or `custom_field_filter`

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetArgs.SubnetAddress
member.summary: and `subnet_mask`

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetArgs.SubnetMask
member.summary: The subnet mask, in bits, of the subnet to look up.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetInvokeArgs.CustomFieldFilter
member.summary:
A map of custom fields to search for. The filter values are regular expressions that follow the RE2 syntax for which you can find documentation [here](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax). All fields need to match for the match to succeed.
⚠️ **NOTE:** Searches with the `description`, `description_match` and `custom_field_filter` fields return the first match found without any warnings. Conversely, the resource fails if it somehow finds multiple results on a CIDR (subnet and mask) search - this is to assert that you are getting the subnet you requested. If you want to return multiple results, combine this data source with the `phpipam.getSubnets` data source. Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.
⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return the first subnetit sees in the section.
Arguments are processed in the following order of precedence:

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetInvokeArgs.Description
member.summary: The subnet's description. `section_id` is required if you want to use this option.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetInvokeArgs.DescriptionMatch
member.summary: A regular expression to match against when searching for a subnet. `section_id` is required if you want to use this option.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetInvokeArgs.SectionId
member.summary: , and either one of `description`, `description_match`, or `custom_field_filter`

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetInvokeArgs.SubnetAddress
member.summary: and `subnet_mask`

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetInvokeArgs.SubnetMask
member.summary: The subnet mask, in bits, of the subnet to look up.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.AllowIpRequests
member.summary: `true` if the subnet allows IP requests in PHPIPAM.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.CreatePtrRecords
member.summary: `true` if PTR records are created for addresses in this subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.CustomFields
member.summary: A key/value map of custom fields for this subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.Description
member.summary: The description set for the subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.DisplayHostnames
member.summary: `true` if hostnames are displayed instead of IP addresses in the address listing for this subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.EditDate
member.summary: The date this resource was last updated.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.Gateway
member.summary: Key map of values: ip_addr, id. ip_addr - this is gateway IP address (like 192.168.1.254). id - gateway ip ID

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.GatewayId
member.summary: The ID of gateway IP address fot this subnet

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.HostDiscoveryEnabled
member.summary: `true` if this subnet is included in new host scans.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.Id
member.summary: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.IncludeInPing
member.summary: `true` if this subnet is included in ping probes.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.IsFolder
member.summary: `true` if this subnet is a folder and not an actual subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.IsFull
member.summary: `true` if the subnet has been marked as full.

member.summary: The ID of the linked subnet in the PHPIPAM database.

member.summary: The ID of the location for this subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.MasterSubnetId
member.summary: The ID of the parent subnet for this subnet in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.NameserverId
member.summary: The ID of the nameserver used to assign PTR records for this subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.Permissions
member.summary: A JSON representation of the permissions associated with this subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.ResolveDns
member.summary: `true` if enabled resolving of DNS names.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.ScanAgentId
member.summary: The ID of the ping scan agent that is used for this subnet.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.SectionId
member.summary: The ID of the section for this address in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.ShowName
member.summary: `true` if the subnet name is are shown in the section, instead of the network address.

member.summary: The subnet mask, in bits.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.UtilizationThreshold
member.summary: The subnet's utilization threshold.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.VlanId
member.summary: The ID of the VLAN for this subnet in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: F:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetResult.VrfId
member.summary: The ID of the VRF for this subnet in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetsArgs.CustomFieldFilter
member.summary:
A map of custom fields to search for. The filter values are regular expressions. All fields need to match for the match to succeed.
You can find documentation for the regular expression syntax used with the `description_match` and `custom_field_filter` attributes [here](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax).
⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return **all** subnets that contain the referenced custom field key! Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetsArgs.Description
member.summary: The subnet's description.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetsArgs.DescriptionMatch
member.summary: A regular expression to match against when searching for a subnet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetsArgs.SectionId
member.summary:
The ID of the section of the subnet.
One of the following below parameters is required:

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetSubnetsInvokeArgs.CustomFieldFilter
member.summary:
A map of custom fields to search for. The filter values are regular expressions. All fields need to match for the match to succeed.
You can find documentation for the regular expression syntax used with the `description_match` and `custom_field_filter` attributes [here](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax).
⚠️ **NOTE:** An empty or unspecified `custom_field_filter` value is the equivalent to a regular expression that matches everything, and hence will return **all** subnets that contain the referenced custom field key! Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.

member.summary: The subnet's description.

member.name: M:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlan.InvokeAsync(Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanArgs,Pulumi.InvokeOptions)
M:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlan.Invoke(Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanInvokeArgs,Pulumi.InvokeOptions)
P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanArgs.L2DomainId
member.summary: The layer 2 domain ID in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanArgs.Number
member.summary:
The number of the VLAN to look up.
One of `vlan_id` or `number` must be supplied. If both are supplied, `vlan_id` is used.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanArgs.VlanId
member.summary: The ID of the VLAN to look up. **NOTE:** this is the database ID, not the VLAN number - if you need this, use the `number` parameter.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanInvokeArgs.L2DomainId
member.summary: The layer 2 domain ID in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanInvokeArgs.Number
member.summary:
The number of the VLAN to look up.
One of `vlan_id` or `number` must be supplied. If both are supplied, `vlan_id` is used.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.GetVlanInvokeArgs.VlanId
member.summary: The ID of the VLAN to look up. **NOTE:** this is the database ID, not the VLAN number - if you need this, use the `number` parameter.

member.name: T:Pulumi.Phpipam.Provider
member.summary: The provider type for the phpipam package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the [documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

member.summary: The password of the PHPIPAM account

member.summary: The username of the PHPIPAM account

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Subnet.CustomFields
member.summary:
A key/value map of custom fields for this subnet.
⚠️ **NOTE on custom fields:** PHPIPAM installations with custom fields must have all fields set to optional when using this plugin. For more info see [here](https://github.com/phpipam/phpipam/issues/1073). Further to this, either ensure that your fields also do not have default values, or ensure the default is set in your TF configuration. Diff loops may happen otherwise! Custom fileds must contain mandatory prefix `custom_`.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.ResolveDns
member.summary: `true` if enabled resolving of DNS names.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.ScanAgentId
member.summary: The ID of the ping scan agent that is used for this subnet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.SectionId
member.summary: The ID of the section for this address in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.ShowName
member.summary: `true` if the subnet name is are shown in the section, instead of the network address.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.SubnetAddress
member.summary: The network address of the subnet.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.SubnetId
member.summary: The ID of the subnet in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.SubnetMask
member.summary: The subnet mask, in bits.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.UtilizationThreshold
member.summary: The subnet's utilization threshold.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.VlanId
member.summary: The ID of the VLAN for this subnet in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.SubnetState.VrfId
member.summary: The ID of the VRF for this subnet in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Vlan.CustomFields
member.summary:
A key/value map of custom fields for this VLAN.
⚠️ **NOTE on custom fields:** PHPIPAM installations with custom fields must have all fields set to optional when using this plugin. For more info see [here](https://github.com/phpipam/phpipam/issues/1073). Further to this, either ensure that your fields also do not have default values, or ensure the default is set in your TF configuration. Diff loops may happen otherwise!

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Vlan.Description
member.summary: The description supplied to the VLAN.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Vlan.EditDate
member.summary: The date this resource was last updated.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Vlan.L2DomainId
member.summary: The layer 2 domain ID in the PHPIPAM database.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Vlan.Name
member.summary: The name/label of the VLAN.

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Vlan.Number
member.summary: The number of the VLAN (the actual VLAN ID on your switch).

member.name: P:Pulumi.Phpipam.Vlan.VlanId
member.summary: The ID of the VLAN to look up. **NOTE:** this is the database ID, not the VLAN number - if you need this, use the `number` parameter.
